document.heading: Food, Environmental, and Economic Development in the District of Columbia Act of 2010

history.narrative: Law 18-353, the “Food, Environmental, and Economic Development in the District of Columbia Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-967, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development and the Committee on Government Operations and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 7, 2010, and December 21, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 19, 2011, it was assigned Act No. 18-703 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-353 became effective on April 8, 2011.
